}}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== This dongle is intended (and sold for) use with '''Sony''''s Blu-ray Disc players and TVs.
"8WUSND06S2A1G" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. This would seem to indicate '''Alpha Networks''' manufacture..
The device has the regdomain of 0x6a (World roaming) in the EEPROM.
An off-brand clone of this device may have been sold as the UWA-BR100.
{{WiFiCert|WFA8104|11/06/2009}}
==Pictures== <center>'''User Images''' <gallery> File:Sony UWA-BR100 top.jpg| File:Sony UWA-BR100 bot.jpg| </gallery></center>[[Has images::external| ]][[Has images::label| ]]
==Notes== This adapter uses AR7010+AR9280 (and presumably also the UB94 reference design for that chipset), which is found [http://www.wikidevi.wi-cat.ru/wiki/Special:BrowseData/Wireless_adapter?chip1model=AR7010&Interface=USB on a few other devices]. It is, however, not likely that any alternative adapters will be usable with '''Sony''' products.
.. and, while this dongle is noted as being incompatible with non-'''Sony''' products within the FCC docs, it should work fine in.. * most versions of Windows, when using AR7010 / some AR9271 drivers (see those used by the [[TP-LINK TL-WN821N v3|WN821N v3]], [[TP-LINK TL-WN822N v2|WN822N v2]], etc) * any recent release of the '''Linux''' kernel, when using the '''ath9k_htc''' driver
[[Category:English Documentation]]
